metadata.title: Living World and Classification of Microbes
metadata.subject: Science
metadata.description: Classification of living organisms and the role of microbes in nature and health.

concepts.title: Classification of Living Organisms
concepts.content: The five-kingdom classification groups organisms based on cell type, body organization, and nutrition. The kingdoms are Monera, Protista, Fungi, Plantae and Animalia.

concepts.title: Microbes and Their Features
concepts.content: Microbes include bacteria, fungi, protozoa, algae and viruses. They are microscopic and found in air, water, soil and living bodies.

examples.text: Yeast is a fungus used in baking.
Viruses need host cells to replicate.

keyTakeaways: Some microbes are harmless or helpful.

concepts.title: Useful vs Harmful Microbes
concepts.content: Microbes are useful in food production, medicine and environmental cycles, but harmful microbes can cause infections in humans, animals and plants.

examples.text: Disease-causing microbes such as cholera bacteria.

keyTakeaways: Vaccines protect from many viral diseases.
